tool.name: Ensemble_Masker

param.name: in_file
param.dialogReference: A NetCDF file containing the ensemble model results created prior. The ensemble variables belief, disbelief, plausibility and interval must exist in the NetCDF and x and y coordinates in GDA 94 Albers projection (3577).

param.name: out_file
param.dialogReference: A NetCDF file containing the same ensemble model results and variables with pixels intersecting that mask input set to NoData (nan).

param.name: in_mask
param.dialogReference: A non-temporal NetCDF or single-banded GeoTiff file. The NetCDF or GeoTiff must have x and y coordinates in GDA 94 Albers projection (3577) and at least intersect some of the ensemble NetCDF input area.

param.name: in_var
param.dialogReference: Select the variable within the mask NetCDF or GeoTiff to use as the mask layer.

param.name: in_type
param.dialogReference:
A mask can be created from the mask NetCDF or GeoTiff using a specific value contained within:

  • Binary: set a single, specific pixel value within the mask input to act as the mask area

  • Range: set a range of values value within the mask input to act as the mask area

param.name: in_binary
param.dialogReference:
Set a single, specific pixel value within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has mine infrastructure represented as a value of 3, set this to 3 to mask out infrastructure.

param.name: in_range_min
param.dialogReference:
Set the minimum value within a range of values within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has undesirable vegetation heights between 0m to 2m, set the minimum to 0 and the maximum to 2 to mask these areas out.

param.name: in_range_max
param.dialogReference:
Set the maximumvalue within a range of values within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has undesirable vegetation heights between 0m to 2m, set the minimum to 0 and the maximum to 2 to mask these areas out.

param.name: in_add_result_to_map
param.dialogReference: Whether to visualise the results to the currently active map once tool is complete or not.

tool.summary: Use a NetCDF or GeoTiff file to mask out undesired areas of the ensemble model output created prior. This tool is useful for remove infrastructure or certain vegetation heights (if a canopy height model is available) from the model.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Lewis Trotter, Todd Robinson, Curtin University, FrontierSI, Digital Earth Australia, Geoscience Australia
